description: go-tour: Adding semicolons that were dropped by gofmt

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: adg@golang.org),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go-tour

https://codereview.appspot.com/7450043/diff/3001/prog/for-continued.go
File prog/for-continued.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7450043/diff/3001/prog/for-continued.go#newcode7
prog/for-continued.go:7: for ; sum < 1000; {
am i missing something here? i think they are
equivalent.

Or, put it another way, if they aren't then
gofmt has a serious bug.

https://codereview.appspot.com/7450043/diff/3001/prog/for-continued.go
File prog/for-continued.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7450043/diff/3001/prog/for-continued.go#newcode7
prog/for-continued.go:7: for ; sum < 1000; {
They are equivalent, that's the point of the slide, showing that the for loop can be simplified dropping the initial and inductive step.

The next slide says these semicolons are not needed anymore and drops them.

On 2013/02/28 19:17:51, minux wrote:
> am i missing something here? i think they are
> equivalent.
> 
> Or, put it another way, if they aren't then
> gofmt has a serious bug.

On Fri, Mar 1, 2013 at 3:20 AM, <campoy@google.com> wrote:
>
>  https://codereview.appspot.**com/7450043/diff/3001/prog/**
> for-continued.go#newcode7<https://codereview.appspot.com/7450043/diff/3001/prog/for-continued.go#newcode7>
> prog/for-continued.go:7: for ; sum < 1000; {
> They are equivalent, that's the point of the slide, showing that the for
> loop can be simplified dropping the initial and inductive step.
>
> The next slide says these semicolons are not needed anymore and drops
> them.

ok i see. LGTM.
too bad we can't just inline the code in the article.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go-tour/source/detail?r=dd4f0b547fbc ***

go-tour: Adding semicolons that were dropped by gofmt

R=golang-dev, minux.ma, r
CC=adg, golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7450043
